qs: Good morning, teacher!
Yes, I can. I am Gia Anh. I am 12 years old, and I am a student at Hoi Nghia Secondary School.
aw: Great! Today, we will talk about greeting people politely. Do you know why it is important to greet people politely?

aw01.st: Great! Today, we will talk about greeting people politely. Do you know why it is important to greet people politely?

qs: I think it shows respect to others and helps start a conversation well.
aw: Oh, so how do you usually greet others?

aw01.st: Oh, so how do you usually greet others?

qs: I usually say, "Good morning" or "Hi, nice to see you."
aw: How do others react after that?

aw01.st: How do others react after that?

qs: They enjoy talking to me. Sometimes they smile and greet me back.
aw: Okay, do you want to say hi to the audience?

aw01.st: Okay, do you want to say hi to the audience?

qs: Hello, everyone! Have a nice day!

charactor.fsp: Okay, do you want to say hi to the audience?

qs: Hello, teacher.
My name is Nghia. I am 12 years old, and I am a student at Hoi Nghia Secondary School.
aw: Today, we will talk about why we should apologize when we make mistakes. Nghia, have you ever made a mistake?

aw01.st: Today, we will talk about why we should apologize when we make mistakes. Nghia, have you ever made a mistake?

qs: Yes, I have.
I said bad things about my friend.
No, but I feel ashamed.
I apologized and said I felt sorry.
Yes, and we are still good friends.
aw: Do you have any advice for others when they make mistakes?

aw01.st: Do you have any advice for others when they make mistakes?

qs: If you are wrong, admit it. It helps relationships.
aw: Great! Now, can you say hi to the audience?

aw01.st: Great! Now, can you say hi to the audience?

qs: Hello, everyone! Hope you have a good day.
No, but I feel ashamed.
